reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel La Paul in July 2006 for our Honeymoon. We actually stayed in the hotel Smeralda, which is located on the oposite side of the road. The location of the hotels is very good. Both hotels have access to the lake which is beautiful. Also location is within walking distance of many Sirmione restuarants, shops, the ferry etc. The swimming pool in La Paul is pretty good, modern, clean, a reasonable size and was never too busy. We found the staff to be helpful and polite and the rooms were sufficiently clean and a fair size. We would be happy to stay at this hotel again as we feel it was good value for the money we paid. There was a lot of insects in our balcony area, probably due to a large tree outside, these were cleaned away by the staff everyday though. The airconditioning in our room was a bit loud but very effective. Only gripe was that when then people in the room next door flushed their toilets it was very loud.

reviews.title: great facilities - lovely view
The rooms are the worst I've ever stayed in
reviews.text: It's a real shame, this could be a really nice hotel, but the rooms have been undermaintained and the staff are far too laid back. The meals were OK - nothing special. On the rooms specifically, the air conditioning had all the power of the breath of an asthmatic cat. The electronic controls were broken as were the side tables attached to the headboad. Never before have I paid so much for such poor quality.

reviews.title: What a hole
reviews.text: Booked the top of the range room at this hotel expecting something quite decent. Room had a metal door, air conditioning was none existent. Buffet dinner at night was covered in flies and breakfast with ants. We could not go out on the balcony because of the thousands of insects. Checked out after only one night. We have stayed in quite a few hotels around Lake Garda and this was by far the worst by a long way. Other guests had similar problems and wished that they were in the position that we were whereby we could just walk out.
